name: Flip Flop (n.s.chaitanya)
description:
Tap the screen and hold to change the objects' orientation. The ball moves in a fixed direction. It only changes direction when it hits the tiles based on their orientation.

How to tap?

  • Mouse Click
  • Trackpad Click
  • Touch Input

After you click/touch, make sure to hold that click/touch. The moment you release, all objects go back to their default orientations! So click and release depending on the situation!

Press "Escape" to come back to the home screen whenever you want!

You can also press 'R' to restart a level, although you might not have to use it...

This game was made as part of  Mini-Jam 101.

The theme was "Limit" and the limitation was "Control the Environment."

  • This game allows you to control all objects on the screen. That's how the limitation was applied.
  • Also, you only have one button to control all the objects at once on the screen. That's how the theme was used. The game is more fun this way!

I had this game idea for two years. I was testing a prototype and abandoned it. After seeing the limitation given by Mini-Jam 101, I've decided to build a new game based on that old idea. 

There are 35 levels as of now.

Note:

People using mobile, can change their browsers to desktop mode and can play the game. Although you cannot use the "Escape" key functionality.

Android:

1. Launch the Chrome browser on Android.

2. Open any website that you want to view in desktop mode.

3. Tap on. for the menu options.

4. Select the checkbox against the Desktop site.

5. The page will automatically reload.

6. The desktop site view will be displayed on the mobile phone.

IOS:

1. Open the Safari browser and navigate to any website.

2. Once the website loads, click the "aA" icon available in the top corner positioned before the address bar. It opens the website view menu.

3. From the available options, choose the "Request Desktop Website" option.

I had a lot of fun making this one!

Let me know what you think about this game!!
